string.value: The name of the parameter. The name is used by the system to identify this parameter. Names must be unique and may not contain spaces and other special characters. Use names like 'Title', 'StartDate', 'LargeImage' etc.
The text that users should see when specifying a value for this parameter. This is the 'human name' for the parameter.
Write a short text that tells the user what to do with the parameter.
You can specify a default value for this parameter. If a parameter has a default value, users are not required to specify it when calling the function.
When previewing you can test with different input parameter values using this field. If this is left blank, the default value will be used for previews.
You can select which type of input widget (like a textbox) to use when specifying a value for this parameter. Widgets are only available for simple types.
The position of the parameter. This controls the order of the parameters.
The specified name is not valid.
Can not save... Another parameter has the same name. Please change the name.
Invalid name. Parameter names can not contain spaces. You can write a readable name in the Label field below.
Parameter names can not be empty. Please specify a name.
Another parameter uses this name. Parameter names must be unique.
